snippet: Two months before the election, President Obama and Mitt Romney agree on at least one thing: the collection of states where the race will be decided.
abstract: Political Memo; Pres Obama and Mitt Romney find themselves in a deadlocked race two months before the election, and both of their campaigns seem to have agreed on the collection of states that will decide the race; five crucial factors to watch to determine the course of the race are the electoral map, the debates, advertisements, third-party candidates on state ballots and the amount of money raised and spent by each campaign and their allies.

byline.original: By JEFF ZELENY and JIM RUTENBERG
byline.contributor: Helene Cooper contributed reporting from Seminole, Fla.

lead_paragraph: Two months before the election, President Obama and Mitt Romney agree on at least one thing: the collection of states where the race will be decided.

headline.seo: Obama-Romney Battle Plans Set for Final Charge
headline.main: Five Crucial Factors to Watch, Just 58 Days From the Election
headline.print_headline: Five Crucial Factors to Watch, Just 58 Days From the Election
